metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6480 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Race condition in the ioctl_send_fib function in drivers/scsi/aacraid/commctrl.c in the Linux kernel through 4.7 allows local users to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds access or system crash) by changing a certain size value, aka a "double fetch" vulnerability. Pengfei Wang discovered a race condition in the Adaptec AAC RAID controller driver in the Linux kernel when handling ioctl()s. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6480` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
